channel.title: Much trouble jaring my client
channel.description: Okay, I'm going to put my client on a web site, but I need it jarred first. I went to sun's tutorial on using jar files, and went [url=http://"http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/deployment/jar/appman.html"]here[/url]. I decided to set my jar's entry point in the program. I copied my jar's class files to my JDK dir\bin\app and ran a command window at my JDK dir\bin. My main class is EGUI so I typed in [code]jar -cfe Main.jar app.EGUI app/*.*[/code] I open up the jar file and get this: [img]http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/2010/errorrq1.png[/img] Can someone tell me what I'm doing wrong?

item.description:
@yppman wrote:

That’s what the -e is for. Read the whole thing before posting.[br][size=1]Posted on: June 27, 2007, 07:19:34 PM[/size][hr]All I need is someone to give the right paremiters to jar this thing with my current setup!

item.title: Much trouble jaring my client
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

You need to tell the Jarring program where the main class file is located.

Read full topic

item.title: Much trouble jaring my client
item.dc:creator: @yppman yppman
item.description:
@yppman wrote:

Okay, I’m going to put my client on a web site, but I need it jarred first. I went to sun’s tutorial on using jar files, and went here. I decided to set my jar’s entry point in the program. I copied my jar’s class files to my JDK dir\bin\app and ran a command window at my JDK dir\bin. My main class is EGUI so I typed in

jar -cfe Main.jar app.EGUI app/*.*

I open up the jar file and get this:

Can someone tell me what I’m doing wrong?

Read full topic
